00003 #  Implement functions on vectors

00005 package Parser::Function::vector;
00006 use strict;
00007 our @ISA = qw(Parser::Function);
00008 
00009 #
00010 #  Check for a single vector-valued input
00011 #
00012 sub _check {(shift)->checkVector(@_)}
00013 
00014 #
00015 #  Evaluate by promoting to a vector
00016 #    and then calling the routine from Value.pm
00017 #
00018 sub _eval {
00019   my $self = shift; my $name = $self->{name};
00020   my $v = $self->Package("Vector")->promote($self->context,$_[0]);
00021   $v->$name;
00022 }
00023 
00024 #
00025 #  Check for a single vector-valued argument
00026 #  Then promote it to a vector (does error checking)
00027 #    and call the routine from Value.pm
00028 #
00029 sub _call {
00030   my $self = shift; my $name = shift;
00031   Value::Error("Function '%s' has too many inputs",$name) if scalar(@_) > 1;
00032   Value::Error("Function '%s' has too few inputs",$name) if scalar(@_) == 0;
00033   my $v = shift; my $context = (Value::isValue($v) ? $v : $self)->context;
00034   $self->Package("Vector")->promote($context,$v)->$name;
00035 }
